text: Which device is used to move the mouse pointer on the screen?
explanation: A mouse is an input device that moves the pointer on the screen.

text: Which of the following is an example of an output device?
explanation: A printer produces a physical copy of digital documents, so it is an output device.

text: Which component is considered the brain of the computer?
explanation: The CPU (central processing unit) performs calculations and instructions.

text: Which connector is commonly used for wired network connections?
explanation: RJ-45 connectors are used for Ethernet network cables.

text: Which operating system is open source?
explanation: Linux is open source and has many different distributions.

text: Which device stores long term data even when the power is off?
explanation: Hard drives and SSDs are examples of non volatile storage.

text: What does the acronym IT stand for?
explanation: IT stands for Information Technology.

text: Which of these is an example of an operating system?
explanation: Windows 10 is a desktop operating system.

text: Which port is most commonly used to connect a modern monitor?
explanation: HDMI is a common digital video and audio connector for monitors.

text: Which of the following is an example of an input device?
explanation: A keyboard allows the user to enter text and commands.

text: What does URL stand for?
explanation: URL stands for Uniform Resource Locator.

text: Which wireless technology is typically used for short range connections like headphones?
explanation: Bluetooth is used for short range wireless connections such as headphones.

text: Which file extension is commonly used for Microsoft Word documents?
explanation: Modern Microsoft Word documents usually use the .docx extension.

text: Which device provides battery backup during a power outage?
explanation: A UPS (uninterruptible power supply) can keep a device running briefly during a power loss.

text: Which of these is an example of cloud storage?
options: Saving files on a USB drive
Saving files on a local hard drive
explanation: OneDrive is a cloud based storage service from Microsoft.

text: What is the main purpose of antivirus software?
explanation: Antivirus software helps detect and remove malware.

text: Which of the following is a strong password example?
explanation: Summer2024! mixes letters, numbers, and a symbol, making it stronger than the others shown.

text: What is phishing?
options: An email scam that tricks you into giving personal data
explanation: Phishing is a social engineering attack often delivered by email.

text: Which unit measures the speed of a CPU?
explanation: CPU speed is often measured in gigahertz (GHz).

text: Which device connects a local network to the internet?
explanation: A router connects the local network to external networks such as the internet.

text: Which term describes a copy of important data stored separately for recovery?
explanation: A backup is a copy of data that can be used to restore the original.

text: Which of the following is an example of an email client?
explanation: Outlook is an email and calendar client.

text: What does the acronym CPU stand for?
explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit.

text: Which component temporarily holds data while programs are running?
explanation: RAM temporarily stores data that the CPU is actively using.

text: Which icon typically represents the Recycle Bin in Windows?
explanation: The Recycle Bin is usually represented by a trash can icon.

text: What is the main purpose of a firewall?
explanation: A firewall filters network traffic to help block unauthorized access.

text: Which of these is a web browser?
explanation: Google Chrome is a popular web browser.

text: Which button combination is commonly used to copy selected text in Windows?
explanation: Ctrl plus C copies the selected item to the clipboard.

text: Which device is needed to connect to a Wi Fi network?
explanation: A wireless network adapter allows a device to connect to Wi Fi.

text: Which term describes a program that appears useful but also has malicious code?
explanation: A Trojan looks legitimate but performs malicious actions.

text: Which of these is a common mobile operating system?
explanation: Android is a common operating system for smartphones and tablets.

text: Which port type is reversible, meaning it can be plugged in either way?
explanation: USB C connectors are reversible.

text: Which action is safest when you receive an unexpected attachment from an unknown sender?
options: Open it to see what it is
Reply asking for more info then open it
explanation: Deleting suspicious attachments without opening reduces the chance of infection.

text: What does GUI stand for?
explanation: GUI stands for Graphical User Interface.

text: Which option best describes the internet?
explanation: The internet is a global network of interconnected networks.

text: Which key is often used to refresh a web page in many browsers?
explanation: F5 is a common shortcut to refresh a web page.

text: Which of these is an example of personal identifiable information?
explanation: A home address is considered personal identifiable information.

text: What is the primary purpose of an operating system?
explanation: The operating system manages hardware and software and provides services for programs.

text: Which of the following connections typically provides the fastest home internet?
explanation: Fiber connections usually offer the highest speeds of these options.

text: Which of the following are examples of input devices? (Select all that apply.)
explanation: A mouse and keyboard are input devices. A monitor and printer are output devices.

text: Which actions help keep your computer secure? (Select all that apply.)
explanation: Using strong passwords and installing updates improves security. Clicking random links and disabling antivirus are unsafe.

text: Which of these are examples of operating systems? (Select all that apply.)
explanation: Windows 11, Android, and macOS are operating systems. Excel is an application.

text: Which of the following are examples of cloud services? (Select all that apply.)
explanation: Google Drive, OneDrive, and Dropbox are cloud storage services. A USB drive is local storage.

text: Which of the following are common web browsers? (Select all that apply.)
explanation: Chrome, Firefox, and Edge are web browsers. Outlook is an email client.

text: The main circuit board in a computer that holds the CPU and other components is called the ________.
explanation: The motherboard is the main circuit board that connects all major components.

text: The global collection of connected networks used to access websites and online services is called the ________.
explanation: The internet is a worldwide network of networks.

text: A secret combination of characters used to verify identity when logging in is called a ________.
explanation: A password is used to authenticate a user.

text: Software that helps you create and edit text documents is called a word ________ application.
explanation: Word processing software lets users create and modify text documents.

text: Malicious software designed to damage or disrupt a system is called ________.
explanation: Malware is a general term for malicious software such as viruses and spyware.

text: Which of the following storage sizes is the largest?
explanation: From smallest to largest: KB, MB, GB, TB. Therefore 1 TB is the largest.
